metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5810 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An error within the "rollei_load_raw()" function(internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.9 can beexploited to cause a heap-based buffer overflow and subsequently cause acrash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.8-1ubuntu0.2
libraw16 - 0.18.8-1ubuntu0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libraw package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.18.8-1ubuntu0.2').
ufraw: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
exactimage: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
